messages.text:
Well, you can also do each of them in just one line:
```julia> const / = + ; sum(l -> eval(Meta.parse(replace(l, '+' => '/'))), eachline("input.txt"))
16332191652452

julia> const ^ = + ; sum(l -> eval(Meta.parse(replace(l, '+' => '^'))), eachline("input.txt"))
351175492232654```

elements.text: Well, you can also do each of them in just one line:

julia> const / = + ; sum(l -> eval(Meta.parse(replace(l, '+' => '/'))), eachline("input.txt"))
16332191652452

julia> const ^ = + ; sum(l -> eval(Meta.parse(replace(l, '+' => '^'))), eachline("input.txt"))
351175492232654

messages.text:
I was surprised to find that calculating the "deck score" of an array is more efficient than `hash`ing it:
```julia> @btime Day22.solve_b("<http://day22.in|day22.in>")
  675.759 ms (1324789 allocations: 212.45 MiB)

julia> @btime Day22.solve_b("<http://day22.in|day22.in>")
  130.972 ms (693296 allocations: 111.40 MiB)```
(where the first is hashing, and the second is score). Although now that I think about it the deck score is prone to collisions - I must have gotten lucky that the answer still comes out the same.

elements.text: I was surprised to find that calculating the "deck score" of an array is more efficient than
hash
ing it:

julia> @btime Day22.solve_b("day22.in")
  675.759 ms (1324789 allocations: 212.45 MiB)

julia> @btime Day22.solve_b("day22.in")
  130.972 ms (693296 allocations: 111.40 MiB)
(where the first is hashing, and the second is score). Although now that I think about it the deck score is prone to collisions - I must have gotten lucky that the answer still comes out the same.

messages.text: <@U01AVQSBTLJ> after doing a Racket version that takes 0.28 seconds, I coded up <https://github.com/lojic/LearningRacket/blob/master/advent-of-code-2020/day23-2.jl|this Julia version> which took 0.18 seconds, so I'm pretty pleased with Julia's speed here (although Racket wasn't terrible for what it is). (spoilers in thread)

messages.text:
I've put together a collection of solutions in Julia for every day from advent of code 2020: <https://blog.kdheepak.com/advent-of-code-2020-retrospective.html>

The intent was to capture the crux of the problem + julia tips / tricks for every day. I wanted to share it here for 2 reasons 1) to see if others may have suggestions for improving any section, 2) to check if anyone doesn't want their name / code in the blogpost. Feel free to message me here or privately if you have feedback!

Thanks! Hope everyone is enjoying their holiday break and having a good end to quite a unique year.

I wanted to share it here for 2 reasons 1) to see if others may have suggestions for improving any section, 2) to check if anyone doesn't want their name / code in the blogpost. Feel free to message me here or privately if you have feedback!

Thanks! Hope everyone is enjoying their holiday break and having a good end to quite a unique year.
